content.description: Fun little cave crack climb! Starts matched on a low sharp left side jug. Work your way through the mini cave while with tricky feet and hand jams to pull out and onto the super slab face to the top. Extremely easy to dab inside the cave. Back touching the opposite wall is unavoidable but feet remain only on the super slab boulder. No pads fit within the cave, a fall inside could be bad and there are many places to smack your head.
content.location: Starts in the tight cave to the left of the super slab. Route follows up out the cave and with the crack,

content.description: Very easy warmup route in the super slab area. very fun, especially for newcomers who are new to outdoor bouldering.
content.protection: pads, whatch for pine needles in some of the holds.
content.location: The route is on the north face of the super slab rock. Directly left of Super Slab just past the corner.

content.description: On left side of slab, climb up crack system using anything you can, Tricky!
content.location: Left most route on the slab

content.description: Find a good way up the middle of slab using edges and side-pulls.  This thing is super fun, the face is huge and loaded with options.
content.location: Top of the Slant boulder field where it joins the 500ft boulder field.  I hiked through the 500ft boulder field from the Tumbled Rocks Trail, to meet with the Slant boulder field.

content.description: Starts on the left side of the seam on sidepulls and goes up through another edge to the top.
content.location: Left of the seam.

content.description: Climb up the far right side of Super Slab.  Fun bouldery start leads to a committing battle with the arete.
content.location: Right side of Super Slab.

content.description: SDS matched on the obvious rail in the raised alcove. Consistent and powerful moves lead out of the overhang. This thing stays on you until the very end. An exceptional problem.Note: This differs from "More Cowbell" in that after hitting the good hold on the left arete, continue directly up the overhanging face rather than turning the corner and topping out the slab.
content.protection: 6+ pads and a spotter. The landing has been considerably improved, but a fall from the wrong spot has potential to be very dangerous.
content.location: North and slightly uphill of Super Slab. Can easily be seen from the Moj/Book of Glass boulder.

content.description:
Start left hand on sidepull and right hand on the arete.  Find some bad feet and go to the lip! 

  Later edit: see video
content.location: Just left of the start to Moj

content.description: Start right hand on a sloper on the lip with a chip out of it and left hand on a nice side pull in the overhanging face and climb the boulder.  Cool slopers and some good tenuous moves.  This is a stand to the Corner Project.
content.protection: Couple pads and maybe a spotter
content.location: Next to Moj.  The starting right hand is the heel most use on that problem.  The easiest way I've found up there is from Pete's Pebble (Classic Overhanging V2 right on the trail on the Tumbled rocks trail) head 100 feet south and follow the talus field straight up staying near the edge of the trees.  At the top of that go straight up into the woods for a couple hundred feet and move right into the other talus field and look up and right and the biggest boulder is the moj boulder.

content.description: Start on good juggy side-pull and gun up for good edges and top-out.
content.location: Just left of Book of Glass.

content.description: SDS on two pod edges near the back of the short cave. Tricky moves on good holds lead to the lip. Trend a bit left for the top out.
content.location: Just behind (north) and slightly uphill of Super Slab. In between Super Slab and The Reaper.

content.description: A good line but intimidating! Start sitting on the ledge. Right sidepull, left pinch. Punch up left to an incut, somehow gain a ledge system out left, then trend more left to a cruxy finish. The end is actually quite safe.Also has been done matched on the right sidepull and maybe a better, slightly more difficult start. Â See what you think.
content.protection: 4 pads at least, the landing is not good.
content.location: On big Boulder 50/100 feet north of Jenga Boulder and facing downhill.

content.description: Start on tiny holds and do a very hard move to the lip and TOP OUT!   This was the Hemarhoads project.
content.location: Just below Moj by a few feet.

content.description: This thing is rad!  Start low on left, establish left hand pinch and stab out right to good edge.  Keep you core tight and get feet set to bump your left hand to the finish.
content.location: On boulder just below the slab boulder.  This problem sits on the north corner of boulder left of the Book of Glass.

content.description: A pretty darn cool one..Start standing with sloper, crimpy pinches. Â Maybe set a toe hook and bust left to a better hold. Â Possibly gain a crimp and another toe hook and gain a good hold up and right. Â Trend left through a seam on pretty good holds, and quest up and left around the corner up a tall and easing slab.
content.location: On the left side of the downhill face of the large Moj Boulder.

content.description: Start from a crouch with your right hand on a bump on the arete, and left on a sidepull (the higher friendly one). Â Do a hard first move to the lip then trend right and finish as for Moj. Â IMO one of the best and fun real hard boulders in the state. Â This was envisioned by Steve Schultz and friends when Moj was first put up and took some effort to get done.
content.location: Moj Boulder.

content.description: Start with good holds low, and using smart foot work, gain small left crimp and throw for jug out right.  Top-out follows lip up and left.
content.location: This problem is a bit hidden.  Walk to the north from the Super Slab, pass large overhanging boulder till you hit a nice corridor with roof, keep going another 50ft and head up.  You should see this boulder.

content.description: Start sitting below the arete, kind of in the corridor,Â matched on an edge. Â Climb the arete. Â The opening move is definitely the crux.
content.location: Just right of A Deeper Understanding, just below the Moj boulder on the little boulder facing north.

content.description: Start low on left side-pull and right on lip.  Traverse left along lip to cool mantle top-out.
content.location: This boulder sits just north of the Cheese boulder.  Problem faces east.

content.description: Climb up book-cove dihedral on boulder just in front of the Super Slab.  This is actually really fun, and much easier than expected. Go get after it, it's worth it!
content.location: On boulder just down from the Super Slab.  This problem faces up hill at the Super Slab.

content.description: Start on the crescent shaped sidepull and go up on miserable holds to a bad sloper.  Looks very hard.
content.location: Starts just right of the seam in the middle of the wall.

content.description: A B side and possibly rarity..Start crouched, right hand with a small undercling and left a foot above on a glassy crimp. Â Climb the wave-like face. Â The start and first move are definitely the crux.
content.location: Just below the large Moj boulder, facing north on a smaller boulder. Â 15-20 feet from Moj and the same boulder as Oklobijaâs Problem.

content.description: In the middle of the West Bluff in the "Slant Boulder Field" that begins from the trail on the lake and heads SW up the hill. In and around this talus field is ALOT of bouldering. Super Slab is one of these areas. You can also find the Dumpster boulder hidden in the trees below this talus field.
